description: Unique identifier for this cost transaction log entry.
Categorizes the inventory cost event (receipt, issue, adjustment, transfer, etc.); coded values.
Identifier of the inventory part affected by the cost transaction.
Warehouse where the partâ€™s inventory is held for this transaction.
Storage bin/location within the warehouse impacted by this transaction.
From-location used when costs arise from a transfer or relocation.
Reference to the originating inventory movement/transaction record this cost entry was derived from.
If the cost adjustment involved a substitute or reclassification, references the other part; confirm with SME.
Number of part units affected by the cost transaction (may be zero for cost-only adjustments).
Per-unit cost applied in the transaction. Negative values indicate a decrease, credit, or reversal.
Physical on-hand quantity considered when recalculating average/weighted cost; likely snapshot at time of transaction; confirm with SME.
Resulting per-unit cost after the adjustment or recalculation.
Identifier of the operating site owning the warehouse/inventory for this transaction.
Specific component or BOM item within an asset associated to the part cost; confirm with SME.
Ordered quantity related to the transaction (e.g., from a purchase order); confirm with SME.
Person who performed the physical count leading to this cost entry.
User who initiated or recorded the transaction.
Related vendor/person contact for the transaction, if applicable; confirm with SME.
Asset/equipment the part was issued to or associated with for costing.
Maintenance procedure or task linked to the costed part usage; confirm with SME.
Project/job code to which the part cost is allocated.
GL account charged/credited by this transaction.
Details or key for splitting cost across multiple GL accounts; confirm with SME.
Related work order driving the part usage or cost.
Reference to the associated purchase order header for this part cost.
Timestamp when the log entry was created.
Effective date/time of the cost change applied.
Flag indicating the transaction is not yet finalized/posted; confirm with SME.
Indicates the record was received from an external application/interface.
Indicates the record was transmitted to an external application/interface.
System timestamp of the last update to this record.
Free-text notes about the cost change, such as old/new unit cost.
Likely supplier/vendor identifier related to the transaction; confirm with SME.
Human-readable purchase order number associated with the transaction.
Unit of measure used when issuing the part from inventory.
Unit of measure used on purchasing documents for this part.
Flag identifying the part as a fluid/fuel item (e.g., 0=no, 1=yes).
Link to a meter/fuel reading adjustment record associated with this transaction; confirm with SME.
Reason or classification code for the transaction; confirm with SME.
Type/category of the associated reason/transaction code; confirm with SME.
Amount or factor used to correct cost/quantity for fuel-related transactions; confirm with SME.
Timestamp when a user last modified this record.
Likely reference to work order accounting posting (AP) batch or queue; confirm with SME.
Likely reference to the actual posted work order accounting record; confirm with SME.
Internal key linking to the purchase order header; confirm with SME.
Internal key/link to the purchase receipt header; confirm with SME.
Line number on the purchase order tied to this transaction.
Line number on the purchase receipt tied to this transaction.
Technician, labor, or cost-center resource associated with the transaction; confirm with SME.
User who originally created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last modified the record.
Timestamp when the record was last modified.
